function_call.name: classify_risks_framework
function_call.arguments: {"sorted_risks":[{"name":"Racial stereotypes perpetuated by covid medical studies influencing brand decisions.","category":"Social Expression","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Risks of mishandling past depictions of slavery in media and entertainment.","category":"Culture/Diversity","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Theorizing and human connectedness in pandemic research impacting societal trust and organizational resilience.","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Theorizing and rebranding without successful implementation","category":"Entrepreneurship","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Rapid turnover of untested ideas leading to fads","category":"Commerce/Trade","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Conflicting and minute guidelines from governments and chain owners creating challenges for food restaurant franchisees in implementing covid-19 reopening protocols.","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Adoption of creative tinkering by firms in various industries due to the constraining nature of regulations.","category":"Entrepreneurship","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Proactive adoption of drive-in screening options by cinema theatres in response to covid-19 regulatory constraints.","category":"Arts","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Theorizing and significant investment in brand meaning without clear economic justification","category":"Wealth Distribution","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Conformity to rules and norms may stifle innovation and growth.","category":"Wealth Distribution","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Deviation from the norm and isomorphism may lead to a lack of adaptation to disruptions like pandemics.","category":"Competitiveness","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Lack of adoption of modern institutional theory may hinder firms from achieving social legitimacy and innovation in dealing with disruptions like pandemics.","category":"Wealth Distribution","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Power dependence theory and institutional theory providing a supplemental and different viewpoint for conceptualizing organizations.","category":"Wealth Distribution","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Integration of institutional theory with past pandemics","category":"Culture/Diversity","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Difficulty achieving theorization in all service sectors","category":"Entrepreneurship","confidence":"Low"},{"name":"Inadequate adaptation to covid-19 disruptions in the service industry","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Ineffective measures to control virus transmission in service environments","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Restructuring the team based on medical project requirements","category":"Entrepreneurship","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Potential spread of contagious diseases through close individual interactions within service smes.","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Relocation decisions based on anticipated access requirements of customers may increase the risk of disease spread.","category":"Transport","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Having informal close relationships and provision of reaching them for overcoming potential future financial constraints","category":"Wealth Distribution","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Value co-creation is broadened to the service network to include other stakeholders such as their competitors","category":"Wealth Distribution","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Service smes’ relationship building and process-enabling capabilities are critical for survival and sustainability in disruptive service conditions.","category":"Wealth Distribution","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Flexibility in reshaping businesses and empowering other parties to shape the nature or process of service provision is essential for service smes.","category":"Entrepreneurship","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"High demand for certain services beyond capacity","category":"Commerce/Trade","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Mutual interaction becoming more vital during the pandemic period","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Lack of synchronization in service processes between partners may lead to miscommunication and an increased risk of inefficiency, potentially impacting the delivery of services and public health","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Dependence on eating out and lack of cooking skills among consumers.","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Open access classes for children may increase the risk of contagion in the community.","category":"Education","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Sharing information and interacting closely with competitors may lead to the transmission of contagious diseases if proper precautions are not taken.","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of ethical interaction capability in service smes","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Relational interactions during the pandemic","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Nonopportunistic processes between actors in smes","category":"Entrepreneurship","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Relational interaction capability may lead to close physical contact between businesses and customers.","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Close interaction and co-creation may lead to increased risk of contagious diseases transmission.","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Lack of customer needs identification","category":"Commerce/Trade","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Inadequate understanding of latent customer needs","category":"Commerce/Trade","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Rapid transfer of resources particularly human resources and technical skills from one project to another","category":"Wealth Distribution","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Change in customer expectations and service requirements due to pandemic","category":"Commerce/Trade","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Decoupling of service offerings to adapt to new customer requirements","category":"Commerce/Trade","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Direct interactions with employees and customers can facilitate the spread of contagious diseases.","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Allowing employees to use company resources for personal work and experimentation may lead to unhygienic conditions and increased risk of disease transmission.","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Rapid deployment of resources and reconfiguration of business systems may lead to oversight of health and safety measures, increasing the risk of disease spread.","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Managers not providing complete understanding of agility capabilities","category":"Health","confidence":"Medium-high"},{"name":"Increased reliance on telemedicine without proper training and protocols","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Facial recognition and photo processing software usage in public digital environments","category":"Security","confidence":"Medium"},{"name":"Zoom video conferencing services may be vulnerable to security breaches and privacy concerns.","category":"Security","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Close customer relationships may increase the risk of disease transmission in service smes.","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Potential spread of contagious diseases in service systems due to enhanced social and emotional links with individual actors within the service system","category":"Health","confidence":"High"},{"name":"Possible spread of contagious diseases in the workplace due to close proximity of employees.","category":"Health","confidence":"High"}]}
